ls.man:
NAME
	ls - list directory contents

SYNOPSIS
	ls [-a] [FILE]...

DESCRIPTION
	List information about the FILEs (the current directory by default).

OPTIONS
	-a, --all
		do not ignore entries starting with .

cd.man:
NAME
	cd - change directory

SYNOPSIS
	cd [dir]

DESCRIPTION
	Change the current directory to dir. The default DIR is the value of the HOME shell variable.

pwd.man:
NAME
	pwd - print name of current/working directory

SYNOPSIS
	pwd

DESCRIPTION
	Print the full filename of the current working directory.

cat.desc: Concatenate files and print on the standard output
cat.man:
NAME
	cat - concatenate files and print on the standard output

SYNOPSIS
	cat [FILE]...

DESCRIPTION
	Concatenate FILE(s) to standard output.

touch.desc: Change file timestamps / Create empty file
touch.man:
NAME
	touch - change file timestamps

SYNOPSIS
	touch FILE...

DESCRIPTION
	Update the access and modification times of each FILE to the current time. If file does not exist, it is created empty.

rm.man:
NAME
	rm - remove files or directories

SYNOPSIS
	rm [FILE]...

DESCRIPTION
	rm removes each specified file. By default, it does not remove directories.

mkdir.man:
NAME
	mkdir - make directories

SYNOPSIS
	mkdir DIRECTORY...

DESCRIPTION
	Create the DIRECTORY(ies), if they do not already exist.

rmdir.man:
NAME
	rmdir - remove empty directories

SYNOPSIS
	rmdir DIRECTORY...

DESCRIPTION
	Remove the DIRECTORY(ies), if they are empty.

cp.man:
NAME
	cp - copy files and directories

SYNOPSIS
	cp [OPTION]... SOURCE DEST

DESCRIPTION
	Copy SOURCE to DEST.

OPTIONS
	-r	copy directories recursively

mv.man:
NAME
	mv - move (rename) files

SYNOPSIS
	mv SOURCE DEST

DESCRIPTION
	Rename SOURCE to DEST, or move SOURCE(s) to DIRECTORY.

head.desc: Output the first part of files
head.man:
NAME
	head - output the first part of files

SYNOPSIS
	head [OPTION]... [FILE]...

DESCRIPTION
	Print the first 10 lines of each FILE to standard output.

OPTIONS
	-n NUM	print the first NUM lines instead of the first 10

tail.desc: Output the last part of files
tail.man:
NAME
	tail - output the last part of files

SYNOPSIS
	tail [OPTION]... [FILE]...

DESCRIPTION
	Print the last 10 lines of each FILE to standard output.

OPTIONS
	-n NUM	print the last NUM lines instead of the last 10

wc.desc: Print newline, word, and byte counts
wc.man:
NAME
	wc - print newline, word, and byte counts for each file

SYNOPSIS
	wc [FILE]...

DESCRIPTION
	Print newline, word, and byte counts for each FILE.

find.desc: Search for files in a directory hierarchy
find.man:
NAME
	find - search for files in a directory hierarchy

SYNOPSIS
	find [path] [pattern]

DESCRIPTION
	Search for files matching the pattern within the specified path (recursive).

grep.man:
NAME
	grep - print lines that match patterns

SYNOPSIS
	grep [OPTIONS] PATTERN [FILE...]

DESCRIPTION
	Search for PATTERN in each FILE.

OPTIONS
	-r	Recursive search in directories
	-i	Case insensitive

clear.man:
NAME
	clear - clear the terminal screen

SYNOPSIS
	clear

DESCRIPTION
	Clears your screen if this is possible, including its scrollback buffer.

echo.man:
NAME
	echo - display a line of text

SYNOPSIS
	echo [STRING]...

DESCRIPTION
	Echo the STRING(s) to standard output.

date.man:
NAME
	date - print the system date

SYNOPSIS
	date

DESCRIPTION
	Display the current system date.

time.man:
NAME
	time - print the system time

SYNOPSIS
	time

DESCRIPTION
	Display the current system time.

whoami.man:
NAME
	whoami - print effective userid

SYNOPSIS
	whoami

DESCRIPTION
	Print the user name associated with the current effective user ID.

uptime.desc: Tell how long the system has been running
uptime.man:
NAME
	uptime - tell how long the system has been running

SYNOPSIS
	uptime

DESCRIPTION
	Display the current time, and how long the system has been running since the page loaded.

history.man:
NAME
	history - display command history

SYNOPSIS
	history [-c]

DESCRIPTION
	Display the list of commands you have typed.

OPTIONS
	-c	Clear the history list

sudo.desc: Execute a command as another user
sudo.man:
NAME
	sudo - execute a command as another user

SYNOPSIS
	sudo COMMAND

DESCRIPTION
	Allows a permitted user to execute a command as the superuser (root). Note: This is a simulation.

sys.info.man:
NAME
	sys.info - display system information

SYNOPSIS
	sys.info

DESCRIPTION
	Displays details about the browser, platform, and screen resolution.

sys.log.man:
NAME
	sys.log - view system logs

SYNOPSIS
	sys.log

DESCRIPTION
	Displays the internal simulated kernel and boot logs.

neofetch.man:
NAME
	neofetch - a command-line system information tool

SYNOPSIS
	neofetch

DESCRIPTION
	Displays information about your operating system, software and hardware in an aesthetic and visually pleasing way.

todo.man:
NAME
	todo - manage a simple todo list

SYNOPSIS
	todo [ACTION] [ARGS]

ACTIONS
	add <text>   Add a new task
	list         Show all tasks
	done <id>    Mark task <id> as complete
	clear [all]  Remove completed tasks (or all)

note.man:
NAME
	note - quickly save a note

SYNOPSIS
	note TEXT

DESCRIPTION
	Saves a quick text note to local storage. Use 'notes' to view them.

notes.man:
NAME
	notes - manage saved notes

SYNOPSIS
	notes [ACTION]

ACTIONS
	list    List all saved notes (default)
	clear   Delete all notes

timer.man:
NAME
	timer - set a countdown timer

SYNOPSIS
	timer [DURATION] | stop

DESCRIPTION
	Sets a timer for the specified duration. Notifies via alert and sound when done.

FORMATS
	10s (seconds), 5m (minutes), 1h (hours)

alarm.man:
NAME
	alarm - set a daily alarm

SYNOPSIS
	alarm HH:MM

DESCRIPTION
	Sets an alarm for a specific time in 24-hour format. If time has passed, sets for the next day.

session.man:
NAME
	session - manage terminal sessions

SYNOPSIS
	session ACTION [NAME]

DESCRIPTION
	Save and restore terminal state (history, path, theme, etc.).

ACTIONS
	save <name>   Save current state
	load <name>   Restore a saved state
	list          Show saved sessions
	delete <name> Delete a session

theme.man:
NAME
	theme - change terminal theme

SYNOPSIS
	theme set NAME

DESCRIPTION
	Changes the color scheme of the terminal.

THEMES
	matrix, kali, ubuntu, neon-purple, hacker-amber

set.man:
NAME
	set - configure terminal settings

SYNOPSIS
	set PROPERTY VALUE

PROPERTIES
	fontSize <px>   Set font size (8-40)
	opacity <0-1>   Set background opacity
	prompt <text>   Set custom prompt string
	startupCmd <cmd> Command to run on start

open.man:
NAME
	open - open external services

SYNOPSIS
	open SERVICE

DESCRIPTION
	Opens a predefined service URL in a new tab. Use 'quicklink' to see available services.

google.man:
NAME
	google - search Google

SYNOPSIS
	google QUERY

DESCRIPTION
	Opens a Google search for the specified query in a new tab.

youtube.man:
NAME
	youtube - search YouTube

SYNOPSIS
	youtube QUERY

DESCRIPTION
	Opens a YouTube search for the specified query in a new tab.

weather.man:
NAME
	weather - get weather information

SYNOPSIS
	weather [gps]

DESCRIPTION
	Fetches current weather. Use 'gps' argument to use your current location, otherwise defaults to API default.

matrix.man:
NAME
	matrix - toggle Matrix rain effect

SYNOPSIS
	matrix

DESCRIPTION
	Enables or disables the background digital rain visual effect.

cowsay.man:
NAME
	cowsay - configurable speaking cow

SYNOPSIS
	cowsay TEXT

DESCRIPTION
	Generates an ASCII picture of a cow saying something.

help.man:
NAME
	help - display help information

SYNOPSIS
	help [COMMAND]

DESCRIPTION
	Display general help or detailed help for a specific command.

man.desc: Format and display the on-line manual pages
man.man:
NAME
	man - format and display the on-line manual pages

SYNOPSIS
	man COMMAND

DESCRIPTION
	Shows the detailed manual page for a command, including synopsis and options.

github.man:
NAME
	github - search GitHub

SYNOPSIS
	github QUERY

DESCRIPTION
	Searches GitHub repositories for the query.

stackoverflow.man:
NAME
	stackoverflow - search StackOverflow

SYNOPSIS
	stackoverflow QUERY

DESCRIPTION
	Searches StackOverflow for questions matching the query.

translate.man:
NAME
	translate - translate text via Google

SYNOPSIS
	translate TEXT [SOURCE-TARGET]

DESCRIPTION
	Translates text. Optional language pair (e.g., en-es, en-hi). Default is auto-detect to English.

map.man:
NAME
	map - open location in Google Maps

SYNOPSIS
	map LOCATION

DESCRIPTION
	Opens Google Maps showing the specified location.

crypto.man:
NAME
	crypto - get cryptocurrency prices

SYNOPSIS
	crypto [SYMBOL]

DESCRIPTION
	Fetches current price of a cryptocurrency. Default is BTC.

news.man:
NAME
	news - fetch latest news headlines

SYNOPSIS
	news

DESCRIPTION
	Fetches top news headlines from external API.

quote.man:
NAME
	quote - get a random quote

SYNOPSIS
	quote

DESCRIPTION
	Displays a random inspirational quote.

shortcut.man:
NAME
	shortcut - manage custom keyboard shortcuts

SYNOPSIS
	shortcut list
	shortcut set KEY_COMBO COMMAND

DESCRIPTION
	Define custom key combinations to trigger specific commands.

settings.man:
NAME
	settings - manage terminal settings

SYNOPSIS
	settings ACTION

DESCRIPTION
	Export settings to JSON file, import from JSON, or reset to defaults.

dev.mode.enable.man:
NAME
	dev.mode.enable - enable developer mode

SYNOPSIS
	dev.mode.enable

DESCRIPTION
	Enables verbose debugging logs in the console.

quicklink.man:
NAME
	quicklink - list available quick links

SYNOPSIS
	quicklink [FILTER]

DESCRIPTION
	Lists all services available for the 'open' command. Optional filter searches by name.

tutorial.man:
NAME
	tutorial - start interactive tutorial

SYNOPSIS
	tutorial [start|commands|shortcuts]

DESCRIPTION
	Guides the user through terminal features.

examples.man:
NAME
	examples - show examples for a command

SYNOPSIS
	examples COMMAND

DESCRIPTION
	Displays usage examples for the specified command.

wiki.man:
NAME
	wiki - search Wikipedia

SYNOPSIS
	wiki QUERY

DESCRIPTION
	Opens a Wikipedia search for the query.

refresh.man:
NAME
	refresh - reload current browser tab

SYNOPSIS
	refresh

DESCRIPTION
	Reloads the currently active browser tab to update the page content.
